users.constants module¶

users.controllers module¶

users.controllers.ambulance_info(request)[source]¶
users.controllers.doctor_dashboard(request)[source]¶

Render the doctor’s dashboard.

This function retrieves the doctor’s appointments for the current day and aggregates the appointments per month for display in the dashboard.

Args:

request: The HTTP request object.

Returns:
HttpResponse: The rendered doctor dashboard page with the doctor’s

information and appointments data.

users.controllers.home(request)[source]¶

Render the home page.

Args:

request: The HTTP request object.

Returns:

HttpResponse: The rendered home page.

users.controllers.lab_technician_dashboard(request)[source]¶
users.controllers.log_in(request)[source]¶

Handle user login.

This function processes login requests and authenticates the user. If the login is successful and the user’s account is approved, the user is redirected to their respective dashboard based on their role.

Args:

request: The HTTP request object.

Returns:

HttpResponse: The rendered login page or a redirect to the home page.

users.controllers.log_out(request)[source]¶

Log the user out and redirect to the home page.

Args:

request: The HTTP request object.

Returns:

HttpResponse: A redirect to the home page after logging out.

users.controllers.patient_dashboard(request)[source]¶
users.controllers.register(request)[source]¶

Handle user registration.

This function processes registration requests, validates the user input, and saves the new user if valid. If the registration is successful, it redirects the user to the unapproved page.

Args:

request: The HTTP request object.

Returns:
HttpResponse: The rendered registration page or a redirect to the

unapproved page.

users.controllers.storekeeper_dashboard(request)[source]¶
users.controllers.unapproved(request)[source]¶

Render the unapproved account page.

This page informs users that their accounts are pending approval.

Args:

request: The HTTP request object.

Returns:

HttpResponse: The rendered unapproved page.

doctor_appointments¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

has_module_perms(app_label)[source]¶

Checks if the user has permissions to view the app app_label.

Parameters:

app_label – The name of the application.

Returns:

True if the user has permissions for the app, False otherwise.

has_perm(perm, obj=None)[source]¶

Checks if the user has a specific permission.

Parameters:

  • perm – The permission name to check.

  • obj – The object to check the permission against (optional).

Returns:

True if the user has the permission, False otherwise.

class users.models.UserManager(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: BaseUserManager

Custom manager for the User model.

create_superuser(email, name, role, blood_group, date_of_birth, gender, phone_number, role_id, password=None, profile_picture='profile_pictures/default_user.png')[source]¶

Creates and saves a superuser with the given email, name, role, blood group, date of birth, gender, phone number, and password.

Parameters:

  • email – User’s email address.

  • name – User’s full name.

  • role – Role of the user (must be ‘admin’ for superusers).

  • blood_group – Blood group of the user.

  • date_of_birth – Date of birth of the user.

  • gender – Gender of the user.

  • phone_number – User’s phone number.

  • role_id – Users’ Unique Role Id.

  • password – User’s password.

  • profile_picture – Path to the user’s profile picture.

Returns:

The created superuser instance.

create_user(email, name, role, blood_group, date_of_birth, gender, phone_number, role_id, password=None, profile_picture='profile_pictures/default_user.png')[source]¶

Creates and saves a User with the given email, name, role, blood group, date of birth, gender, phone number, password, and profile picture.

Parameters:

  • email – User’s email address.

  • name – User’s full name.

  • role – Role of the user (e.g., patient, doctor).

  • blood_group – Blood group of the user.

  • date_of_birth – Date of birth of the user.

  • gender – Gender of the user.

  • phone_number – User’s phone number.

  • password – User’s password.

  • role_id – User’s role id.’

  • profile_picture – Path to the user’s profile picture.

Raises:

ValueError – If no email is provided.

Returns:

The created User instance.

users.urls module¶

URL configuration for user authentication views.

This module defines the URL patterns for user-related actions such as registration, login, logout, and handling unapproved users.

URLs: - /create-account/ : View for user registration. - /login/ : View for user login. - /logout/ : View for user logout. - /unapproved/ : View for handling unapproved users. - /doctor-dashboard/ : View for Doctor dashboard.
